symptoms.name: Eye redness
symptoms.pattern: Present in both babies and adults

symptoms.name: Swelling of the conjunctiva (chemosis)
symptoms.pattern: Present in both babies and adults

symptoms.name: Itchy eyes
symptoms.pattern: Present in both babies and adults

symptoms.name: Eye tenderness or pain
symptoms.pattern: Present in both babies and adults

symptoms.name: Swollen eyelids
symptoms.pattern: Present in both babies and adults

symptoms.name: Eye discharge
symptoms.pattern: Present in both babies and adults, leading to difficulty opening eyes in the morning

risk_factors: Exposure to infected vaginal fluids during birth (neonates)
Direct or indirect contact with infected genital secretions (adults)

required: Clinical presentation consistent with gonococcal conjunctivitis
Positive Gram stain showing intracellular gram-negative diplococci
supportive: History of exposure to infected individual
Elevated white blood cell count in conjunctival exudate
